p: This review included medicinal plants from different families exhibiting anti-TB activities. Table 1 shows information on these medicinal plants, including plant family, scientific name, country of origin, mode of preparation/active compound, mode of action (MIC value) and traditional uses. These plant species have different ethnomedical uses. A total of 184 plants species representing 73 families and 165 plants species (88%) show good correlations with treatment of TB or signs of respiratory disease, such as coughing, pulmonary infections, asthma and bronchitis ( Table 1). A total of 93 plant species accounted for 51% of the active compounds against MTB (crude extracts and/or bioactive compounds with MICs of 0–<100 µg/ml).
